subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
Phonetic borrowing – originally represented a bag tied at both ends (like a cellophane-wrapped candy with the ends twisted), and was later borrowed phonetically to mean “east”. This borrowing may have been influenced by reinterpreting the character as the sun ({{zh-l|*日}}) rising behind a tree ({{zh-l|*木}}), which is the traditional (though incorrect) etymology, as given in ''{{w|Shuowen}}''.

subSections.title: Etymology 7
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=i}}

Nominalization of the stem of adjective {{m|ja|明らか|tr=akiraka||[[clear]]}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 9
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=i}}

Nominalization of the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem or continuative form}} of verb {{m|ja|始める|tr=hajimeru||to [[begin]], [[start]]}}.

subSections.title: Compounds
Readings
subSections.text:
* Native: く (ku), くち (kuchi), あがり (agari)
* Nonnative: とー (tō), とぅ (tu)

subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text:
* [[東風]] (くち, kuchi): east wind, easterly wind, eastern wind
* [[東風]] (くちかじ, kuchikaji): east wind, easterly wind, eastern wind
* [[東京]] (とーちょー, tōchō): Tokyo
* [[広東瓜]] (くゎんとぅうい, kwantuui): watermelon

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: From {{m|ryu|上り|tr=agari|gloss=ascent, rise}} in reference to the direction where the sun rises, ascends.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: From {{m|yox|上り|tr=agari|gloss=ascent, rise|sc=Jpan}} in reference to the direction where the sun rises, ascends.
